etymologies: mid 19th century: via German from Greek topos ‘place’+ -logy

definitions: the way in which constituent parts are interrelated or arranged

examples.text: using distances determined in this manner ignores existing road conditions and topology that can potentially affect travel time and costs
the topology of a computer network

shortDefinitions: way in which constituent parts are interrelated or arranged

definitions: the study of geometric properties and spatial relations unaffected by the continuous change of shape or size of figures.
shortDefinitions: study of geometrical properties and spatial relations

definitions: a family of open subsets of an abstract space such that the union and the intersection of any two of them are members of the family, and which includes the space itself and the empty set.
shortDefinitions: family of open subsets of abstract space
